comments:
Cannot open visual file editor in latest stable VE on eclipse 3.0.1, FC3, locale
en_GB, get "can't open part" error, log includes MissingResourceException for
org.eclipse.gef.ui.palette.messages.


Environment:
Eclipse 3.0.1 (for x86) on Fedora Core 3 (x86_64 arch).
x86 version of eclipse installed with packages from jpackage.org
and visual editor either from 

To reproduce:

0. Be in locale en_GB (I guess).

1. Open eclipse.

2. In my case a saved session was restored with one visual editor to open.
Otherwise, attempt to open a visual editor file using the navigator on the left. 

3. Get an error dialog:
     "Unable to create part:   " (except if workspace saved session opens the
editor automatically)

4. Get an error dialog stacked on top:
     "Invalid Thread Access".

5. OK to both error dialogs.

6. Editor tab left [with no title] containing in red:
     "An error has occurred when creating this editor"

I close the broken tab and repeat these steps, opening a visual file using the
navigator.

From log file:

!SESSION Dec 23, 2004 16:18:09.810 ---------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=200409161125
java.version=1.4.2_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_GB <- *** I guess this
is of consequence ***

Background:

I am moving eclipse from Windows XP to Fedora Core 3 with eclipse 3.0.1 packages
from jpackage.org 1.6, plus emf-sdo-runtime-2.0.1.zip & VE-runtime-1.0.2.zip).
Also tried upgrading using eclipse's automatic upgrade, no difference.

I'm on a 64-bit AMD box (running x86 eclipse & x86_64 FC3). Eclipse+VE have been
working fine on win32. Eclipse itself works perfectly for me on linux but not VE.

My locale is en_GB (UK).

More info or help to debug available on request.

Eclipse and VE are superb, thank you all.
Merry xmas.
Please excuse missing sentence in report :)

I tried reproducing the defect without success on a RHEL 3.0 system. I basically
used a VE 1.0.2 build and its GTK pre-requisites from the download site. 

When you mentioned you moved from XP to FC3 - did you move the plugins also - or
just the workspace?

Also could you please try downloading and running a fresh VE 1.0.2 to see if it
is still reproduceable. 

Also did you download the <chip> 64bit versions of eclipse?

Please provide the additional information requested above so that we could
quickly solve this problem.

Info as requested: I only 'moved' the workspace, not the plugins (actually its
on a network share). I've not tried running an amd64 setup yet, as I tried 32bit
first.

I've now got eclipse & VE working. From newsgroups and install notes I
discovered that VE requires the eclipse SDK and will not work from the runtime.

With this in mind I removed all eclipse RPMs then extracted all the required zip
files directly onto my filesystem along with the eclipse SDK. VE works in this
setup.

The reason I encountered this problem was that being on an rpm-based system I
installed eclipse from rpm with one command as I normally would do, and avoided
the eclipse zip files as I naturally try to minimise the number of non-RPM files
I install onto my filesystem. Once eclipse was working I extracted
VE-runtime.zip and it's other deps to /usr/share/eclipse.

Eclipse as packaged by  jpackage.org is runtime not SDK, and since they don't
yet package the Visual Editor, they had not encountered a dependency on the SDK
and so from what I could see did not provide it.

If I find time to do so I will report this to the jpackage.org maintainers and
ask if they could possibly package both the eclipse SDK and latest stable VE.

VE requires eclipse runtime + JDT + PDE to work properly. It could be that the
eclipse runtime provided by jpackage.org doesnt contain this - could you please
verify if this is true. Eclipse SDK contains the JDT and the PDE bundled in it,
which might explain its working correctly with an SDK. We havent tested VE with
the distribution provided by jpackage.org, so we would need your help in
determining the problem. 

Also I would like to clarify certain things: 
1) Your processor is a 64 bit processor ?
2) The eclipse that was run was a 64 bit GTK SDK build ?

As far as I understood, you were able to make VE work once you extracted the
Eclipse SDK and VE's dependencies, instead of using jpackage.org's runtime - is
this correct ?

> VE requires eclipse runtime + JDT + PDE to work properly. It could be that the
eclipse runtime provided by jpackage.org doesnt contain this - could you please
verify if this is true. 

The jpackage.org rpms do contain these components. Jpackage distribute the
following binary eclipse packages in jpackage 1.6:

eclipse-gef-3.0.1-2jpp.noarch.rpm
eclipse-gef-javadoc-3.0.1-2jpp.noarch.rpm
eclipse-gtk2-3.0.1-5jpp.i586.rpm
eclipse-jdt-3.0.1-5jpp.i586.rpm
eclipse-pde-3.0.1-5jpp.i586.rpm
eclipse-platform-3.0.1-5jpp.i586.rpm
eclipse-scripts-3.0.1-5jpp.i586.rpm
eclipse-source-3.0.1-5jpp.i586.rpm

> Eclipse SDK contains the JDT and the PDE bundled in it,
which might explain its working correctly with an SDK. We havent tested VE with
the distribution provided by jpackage.org, so we would need your help in
determining the problem. 

I installed all of the above packages, which include the JDT and PDE.

> Also I would like to clarify certain things: 

> 1) Your processor is a 64 bit processor ?

Yes.

> 2) The eclipse that was run was a 64 bit GTK SDK build ?

It was a 32-bit GTK build. I'm unable to determine whether it is a runtime or
SDK build based on the installed files.

> As far as I understood, you were able to make VE work once you extracted the
Eclipse SDK and VE's dependencies, instead of using jpackage.org's runtime - is
this correct ?

Yes. VE worked when I removed the rpms and extracted the eclipse SDK and related
files from the original zips.

> Yes. VE worked when I removed the rpms and extracted the eclipse SDK 
> and related files from the original zips.

VE unfortunately has not been tested with the jpackage.org's bundle. Since this
problem happens with their bundling and not with the regular VE bundling, could
you please close the defect here in VE and open it with jpackage.org so that
they can pull in the correct dependencies of VE?
Please reopen this defect if it occurs on a regular VE build.

causedBy.message: Can't find bundle for base name org.eclipse.gef.ui.palette.messages, locale en_GB
